long_desc.thetext: Bugzilla test configurations should be managed through puppet.

From bug 386344 comment 15:
I modified a few things in the last patch set: * The mysql root password is not changed. This would interfere with other puppet scripts running on the same VM. * All perl modules are consumed as system packages to avoid long perl compile processes. * XML-RPC is disabled by modifying the script rather than relying on a perl module not being present. * The Vagrant port is changes to be consistent with other Mylyn configurations.
Frank, I would prefer if the Bugzilla Apache configurations were located under /home/tools/bugzilla rather than in the global configuration and included in the same way as the Trac sites.

I rebased the change and updated the commit message to reference this task so we can track the globabl configuration on the parent task. Frank, in order to move things forward I'm okay with submitting the current state and making refinements in subsequent commits.
Reviews for reference:
The Vagrant files for Bugzilla https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/8033/ The Bugzilla test changes https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/8489/ The changes for Trac https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/8488/
This petchset refs/changes/33/8033/20 is now in master

Frank, there were a bunch of test failures in the last build. Not sure if these are related to the test changes or if something went wrong on Hudson:
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /opt/users/hudsonbuild/hudson/workspace/mylyn-integration-connectors/org.eclipse.mylyn/org.eclipse.mylyn.tests/target/mylyn4909658191716750888.tmp (No such file or directory) at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:149) at org.eclipse.mylyn.bugzilla.tests.BugzillaAttachmentHandlerTest.testDownloadAttachmentFile(BugzillaAttachmentHandlerTest.java:578)

Some standalone tests are now failing with this error:
https://hudson.eclipse.org/hudson/user/spingel/my-views/view/Mylyn/job/mylyn-integration-standalone/

(In reply to comment #4) > Frank, there were a bunch of test failures in the last build. Not sure if > these are related to the test changes or if something went wrong on Hudson: > > java.io.FileNotFoundException: > /opt/users/hudsonbuild/hudson/workspace/mylyn-integration-connectors/org. > eclipse.mylyn/org.eclipse.mylyn.tests/target/mylyn4909658191716750888.tmp > (No such file or directory) > at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method) > at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:149) > at > org.eclipse.mylyn.bugzilla.tests.BugzillaAttachmentHandlerTest. > testDownloadAttachmentFile(BugzillaAttachmentHandlerTest.java:578)
I saw this sometime in my local environment but can nor reproduce this. Should we temporary disable testDownloadAttachmentFile?

No, let's look into the cause of the failure. I'm suspecting that DownloadAttachmentJob runs into an exception and hence deletes the file (see exceptionThrown flag). We should change the test to use AttachmentUtil.downloadAttachment() instead of DownloadAttachmentJob so we can detect the exception.

(In reply to comment #5) > Some standalone tests are now failing with this error: > > https://hudson.eclipse.org/hudson/user/spingel/my-views/view/Mylyn/job/mylyn-integration-standalone/ > > Test Results for Build 148 For the Bugzilla Tests if looks like we have an build problem because we did not find class TasksUiPlugin.

(In reply to comment #7) > No, let's look into the cause of the failure. I'm suspecting that > DownloadAttachmentJob runs into an exception and hence deletes the file (see > exceptionThrown flag). We should change the test to use > AttachmentUtil.downloadAttachment() instead of DownloadAttachmentJob so we can > detect the exception.
The exception is org.apache.commons.httpclient.ConnectionPoolTimeoutException: Timeout waiting for connection.
an review is coming soon.

create the tool user (https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/8631/).
Not sure if I add the correct groups for the tools user. Please verify.

(In reply to comment #9) > The exception is org.apache.commons.httpclient.ConnectionPoolTimeoutException: > Timeout waiting for connection.
Interesting. Do you know what is causing that? Benny was seeing that as well but I wasn't able to track down the cause, yet.

Yes i can reproduce this with the new localhost setup for bugzilla. Maybe this is only when we have an fast response from the server.
Here are some parameter from my actual test.
MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager.doGetConnection(HostConfiguration, long) line: 497
with
this MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager (id=456) hostPool MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager$HostConnectionPool (id=458) waitingThread MultiThreadedHttpConnectionManager$WaitingThread (id=460) useTimeout true timeToWait 0 startWait 1352658246433 endWait 1352658276433 hostConfiguration HostConfiguration (id=462) timeout 30000 connection null maxHostConnections 2 maxTotalConnections 20
patch set 3 has the changes for create all files for user tools and run with the latest bugzilla versions (http://www.bugzilla.org/news/#release424).

(In reply to comment #13) > maxHostConnections 2 > maxTotalConnections 20
Can you check what connections are in the poll when the test failure occurs? We need to figure out if there is something in the Bugzilla connector that is leaking connections.
(In reply to comment #8) > (In reply to comment #5) > > Some standalone tests are now failing with this error: > > > > > https://hudson.eclipse.org/hudson/user/spingel/my-views/view/Mylyn/job/mylyn-integration-standalone/ > > > > Test Results for Build 148 > For the Bugzilla Tests if looks like we have an build problem because we did > not find class TasksUiPlugin.
The standalone tests do not load any of the UI bundles and must not have any UI dependencies. It's a problem in the tests that was introduced by a recent change.
I have opened bug 396760 to track the standalone test failures. The connection leak was addressed as part of bug 395010. Looks like we are done here.
Pushed a minor fix here: https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/9416/. Frank, would be great if you could review and submit.
